subject: Technology
title: Television's Legacy: How TV Changed Humanity
description: A short lesson to help you apply Television's Legacy: How TV Changed Humanity.

hook.text: Television brought the moon landing, the Berlin Wall, and 9/11 into living rooms. It made humanity a single audience.

buildup.text: Before TV, most people only knew their local community. Television showed the world to itself for the first time.

discovery.text: TV created global culture: shared references, shared heroes, shared moments that transcended language and borders.

twist.text: But TV also homogenized culture, replaced conversation with consumption, and turned citizens into audiences.

climax.text: Television's form keeps changing but its power remains. The screen is still humanity's primary storytelling medium.

punchline.text: TV showed the world to itself. We've been watching ever since.

quiz.question: What is television's most significant cultural impact?
options: It created a shared global culture by bringing major events into homes worldwide
It eliminated the need for travel
